decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Elves creatures, allowing for explosive plays with either Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith to put a powerful creature onto the battlefield. Glimpse of Nature provides card advantage for the deck, while Wirewood Symbiote allows for additional creature triggers. The deck aims to quickly assemble a combination of creatures and mana to overwhelm the opponent with a large threat like Craterhoof Behemoth for a finishing blow.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while using Stoneforge Mystic to fetch powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The combination of True-Name Nemesis and equipment makes it difficult for opponents to deal with threats effectively. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and powerful bounce effects, while Lingering Souls gives the deck a resilient threat. Supreme Verdict is a versatile sweeper, allowing the deck to reset the board when needed. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and fetch lands.

The deck focuses on using low-cost disruptive spells and efficient creatures to apply constant pressure on the opponent. By leveraging cards like Lightning Bolt, Daze, and Stifle, combined with threats like Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets, the deck aims to control the board and push through damage quickly. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors. Through a mix of disruption and aggression, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Knight of the Reliquary, and Deathrite Shaman to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Gaddock Teeg and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck utilizes Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Qasali Pridemage and Stoneforge Mystic to find equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords of Light and Shadow. The mana base is designed to support the strategy with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle. The deck aims to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's plans to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying efficient threats to pressure them. With a combination of disruption cards like Hymn to Tourach, Stifle, and Force of Will, as well as efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to control the game early on and then close it out with powerful threats like Tombstalker and Liliana of the Veil. The mana base is built to support this strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and efficient creatures to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis alongside countermagic spells like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Spell Snare, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total. The mana base consisting of fetch lands and dual lands ensures consistent mana production while also enabling cards like Wasteland for additional disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard mechanics to quickly fill the board with creatures and overwhelm the opponent. By dredging through the deck, the player aims to abuse cards like Bridge from Below, Cabal Therapy, and Dread Return to bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Flayer of the Hatebound. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on by constantly bringing back creatures from the graveyard and creating a strong board presence that is difficult for the opponent to deal with.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo - Show and Tell deck is to quickly ramp up mana and cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Brainstorm and Ponder help with card selection and finding the combo pieces, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional card advantage and control. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize. Utilizing powerful disruption and card selection spells like Brainstorm and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and ensure a steady flow of threats. The mana base is designed to support a variety of powerful interactions, allowing for versatile plays and adaptability to different matchups. This deck excels at quickly overwhelming opponents with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and creatures. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Grim Lavamancer, while also utilizing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Fireblast to finish off the opponent. The mana base is optimized for fast, consistent plays with fetch lands like Wooded Foothills and Scalding Tarn. Overall, this deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in dealing damage to win the game.

This deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle to control the game. Using a combination of cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag, the deck aims to maintain tempo and card advantage. The mana base is composed of dual lands to support the deck's color requirements and enable consistent early game plays.

The focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, allowing for explosive combos with cards like Time Spiral and Turnabout. The deck also includes cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for combo pieces, as well as Counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The inclusion of Cunning Wish adds versatility by allowing access to a sideboard of useful cards. The mana base consists mainly of Islands and fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The primary focus of this Legacy Merfolk deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the game and protect its creatures. With efficient creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its speedy and powerful Merfolk tribal synergy.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt opponents' strategies with powerful artifacts while ramping up mana quickly to play big threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Blightsteel Colossus. By playing cards like Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and Lodestone Golem, the deck aims to slow down opponents and control the board. The deck also has tools for card draw and protection, with cards like Staff of Nin and Lightning Greaves. Overall, the focus is on fast mana acceleration and powerful artifact creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, while also generating card advantage with Ancestral Vision and Baleful Strix. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and combine disruptive elements with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color strategy, with land destruction provided by Wasteland. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional value and control.

The main concept of this deck is to gain control of the game through a combination of disruption and powerful threats. Using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate card advantage and create a powerful board presence. By controlling the game with counter magic and removal spells, the deck can dominate the battlefield and secure a win with powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and equipment like Batterskull.
